text:
Helo guys !

Anyone know how I can eliminate the paragraph empty from rich text editor?
For example in my editor I have a single paragraph but when I go on the page and I open the inspect element I see 2 paragraph one before and other is after my current paragraph .
I don't understand why happen this .
Can  anyone help me ?
This is a screenshot :
Hie <@U01795THMLL> you can eleminate it from editor or if it is coming automatically then you have to write a javascript function to remove the empty paragraph.
Hi <@U01DWA6D4Q4> It is coming automatically . I think that must to write a javascript function for remove empty paragraph .
ok..then you have to write javascript, LMK if you need any help

Hey,
I found bug (or a feature) in variable *request.query_dict*.
If u have *&* hubl just skips it and rest of value.
Example:
I think this is an invalid URL. The & in the query param should be URL encoded

Hey !

I work on blog post listing and I want to display the date for each post .
Does anyone know how I can do this ?
{{ content.publish_date_localized }}
<@U01795THMLL> what is the content (source code) of that Rich Text module?
<@UN0NUBU3S> This is  .
And this is what I see on the page when I open the source code.
Is there not also an `<h2>` above and `<div>` below? In that^ RT module I don’t see why/how empty `<p></p>` tags would appear

These (h2> and <div>) come from a custom module . But in this custom module I have a  rich text module , in this rich text I have only one paragraph <@UN0NUBU3S> . My solution for this is to create a javascript function which to eliminate the paragraph which are empty. But I am not sure if this solution is best practice . Maybe I can solve in other way but I don't have other solution in this moment.
This is my custom module .
Thank you <@U38EZFVFE> :slightly_smiling_face:
yep.
you can edit the way it looks in settings

Although that may work, that’s not resolving the _source_ of the problem. Seems like the solution be to _prevent_ the empty <p> tags in the first place.

What’s the source code of the custom module? Perhaps there are errant `<p>` tags there? I _don’t believe it’s the fault of the Rich Text module_, as I’ve never seen errant `<p>` tags render before from within a RT module.
